thread.title: Mum found hanged after move to specialist mother and baby unit blocked
thread.title_full: Mum found hanged after move to specialist mother and baby unit blocked

title: Mum found hanged after move to specialist mother and baby unit blocked
text:
MEN RIP: Rachel Morgan, who was found hanged at Trafford General Hospital 
Rachel Morgan, 28, from Bolton was found hanged in Trafford General Hospital weeks after the birth of her second child, an inquest into her death reportedly heard yesterday. 
Relatives said the mum-of-two had attempted suicide several times after suffering visions of her newborn being thrown out of car window and run over, the Manchester Evening News reported. 
Medics reportedly referred Rachel to a special mother and baby unit at Wythenshawe Hospital. 
But the transfer was blocked by social workers, the court heard. 
CAVENDISH SCENE OF TRAGEDY: Trafford General Hospital, where Rachel was found hanged “It was a place where Rachel thought she could go with her symptoms and be with her baby” Jill Robinson 
Rachel was said to have coped well with the birth of her first child at the age of 17. 
But she became anxious and detached after her second baby arrived in September 2015, relatives said. 
Rachel’s mum, Jill, took her to Royal Bolton Hospital after she started experiencing disturbing visions about her child. 
But the maternity unit there refused to see her, the MEN reports. 
CAVENDISH REFUSAL: Relatives said Royal Bolton Hospital refused to see Rachel 
Rachel feared she might be suffering from postpartum psychosis – a severe mental illness which occurs suddenly after having a baby. 
A GP prescribed her anti-depressants – but Mrs Robinson said Rachel became increasingly paranoid about “losing her mind” or “ending up in an institution”. 
She tried to cut her wrists and was found by police threatening to jump from Barton Bridge, Greater Manchester, in January 2016, relatives told the court. 
MEN SITE: Rachel was reportedly ready to jump from Barton Bridge 
In April 2016, Rachel was sectioned and admitted to the Medlock mental health ward at Trafford General. 
Mrs Robinson and Rachel’s partner told the inquest she wanted to be referred to the special mother and baby unit at Wythenshawe Hospital. 
Mrs Robinson said: “It was a place where Rachel thought she could go with her symptoms and be with her baby.” 
But after social workers blocked the move, Rachel was found hanged and unresponsive in her hospital room on April 16, 2016. 
She died in hospital several days later. 
The inquest continues. 
For confidential support call the Samaritans in the UK on 116 123 or visit a local Samaritans branch. Related articles
